alert.note: Alert for Cooke; Grayson (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 15 at 8:18PM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Cooke and southwestern Grayson Counties through 900 PM CDT... At 817 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Lake Kiowa, or 10 miles southwest of Whitesboro, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Sherman, Gainesville, Whitesboro, Pilot Point, Van Alstyne, Howe, Pottsboro, Collinsville, Gunter, Knollwood, Dorchester, Lake Kiowa, Ray Roberts Park Johnson Branch, Lake Texoma, Southmayd, Tioga, Road Runner, Sadler, Elmont and Lake Ray Roberts. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
